definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to loathe

sentences.english: The demon of greed ruined the miser's happiness.
sentences.chinese: 贪得无厌的恶习毁掉了那个守财奴的幸福。

sentences.english: You’ve got to overcome always wanting more.
sentences.chinese: 你需要克服总是贪得无厌的心态。

sentences.english: Insatiably greedy people will surely invite misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 贪得无厌的人，必然招致祸殃。

sentences.english: He is ravenous and insatiable, the "dragon-snake that eats its own tail".
sentences.chinese: 他饥饿且贪得无厌，是一条“咬尾的龙蛇”。

sentences.english: In old age, he should abstain from acquisitiveness.
sentences.chinese: 年老时血气衰弱，要警戒，不可贪得无厌。

sentences.english: Ladies, accept it, men have an almost insatiable appetite for sex.
sentences.chinese: 女士们，请接受这一点，男人对性是贪得无厌的。

sentences.english: The most acquisitive firms tend to be engineering groups.
sentences.chinese: 最贪得无厌的公司往往是工程队。

sentences.english: People are insatiably curious and seem determined to mine every nook of nature.
sentences.chinese: 贪得无厌的人好奇，似乎要尝试克隆自然的一切。
女孩们越来越贪得无厌。

sentences.english: Instead of contenting himself with what he had, he was always asking for more.
sentences.chinese: 他不仅不知足，反而总是贪得无厌。

sentences.english: He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
sentences.chinese: 有终日贪得无厌的，义人施舍而不吝惜。

sentences.english: Is insatiably greedy is with the desire shop on to grave road.
sentences.chinese: 贪得无厌是用欲望铺就的通向坟墓的路。

definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
to be greedy in getting money
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
bottomless pit of desire (idiom); insatiable greed/carnal cravings are never satisfied and are a main obstruction on the path to enlightenment
greedy
a man who is never content is like a snake trying to swallow an elephant (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 xin1 bu4 zu2 she2 tun1 xiang4

definition: to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
avaricious/greedy/rapacious/insatiable/avid
lit. covet Sichuan once Gansu has been seized/fig. endless greed/insatiable desire
blinded by greed (idiom)
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
greed/avarice/rapacious/avid
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
variant of 唯利是圖|唯利是图[wei2 li4 shi4 tu2]
to be shortsighted
greedy for sex/given to lust for women
